title: Cedar Creek & Belle Grove National Historical Park: NPS Centennial
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     NPS Centennial            NPS Centennial       The National Park Service turns 100 on August 25, 2016. As we lead up to the centennial, we invite you to participate in Find Your Park Experiences to learn, discover, be inspired, or simply have fun in national parks. Find Your Park Experiences offer unique opportunities to explore national parks both in person and online. Check out the experiences in this park or search all experiences to identify an opportunity that matches your interests. You can also share your national park story at FindYourPark.com. A Call to Action remains the foundation for our 2016 centennial preparations. It is the National Park Service's blueprint for the future, outlining the innovative work we want to accomplish. Cedar Creek & Belle Grove National Historical Park is a big part of this effort. Take a look at what we're doing and get involved!   Experiences      Become A Junior Ranger  Ranger Eric Campbell leading a kids program. Read more      Call to Action Projects      24 New Passport Stamps Commemorate the Shenandoah Valley  The Shenandoah Valley Battlefields National Historic District recently added 24 new passport stamps to the Passport Program. The 24 new stamps are spread out throughout the Historic District, from Staunton to Winchester, Virginia, and represent the profound impacts that the Civil War had on the Shenandoah Valley. Read more        2016 Centennial Projects, Programs, and Events        Projects   ·Morning Attack Trails hiking extension project –creation of 1.3 miles of new trail (on NPS property), along with new interpretive media (including an 8 page, full color brochure) which covers part of the morning fight at the Battle of Cedar Creek (October 19, 1864).This will extend the current 8th Vermont Monument Trail (0.2 miles), for a total of 1.5 miles of trail.   The three trails include:   8th Vermont Monument Trail (0.2 miles) Thomas Brigade Loop Trail (0.6 miles) Hayes-Ramseur Loop Trail (0.7 miles)   Completion Date:Spring 2016     ·19th Corps Entrenchment Trail extension project –creation of 0.6 miles of new trail (on National Trust for Historical Preservation property), along with new interpretive media (including a trail brochure) which follows a large section of original Civil War earthworks constructed by the Union army prior to the Battle of Cedar Creek (October 19, 1864) and used during the battle.This will expand the existing trail (on Cedar Creek Battlefield Foundation property), for a total of 1.0 miles of trail (2.0 miles out-and-back).This project will involve using volunteers on Park Day (April 2, 2016) and the PATC (to construct 3 footbridges over the entrenchments)   Completion Date: Spring/Summer 2016     ·Design, Fabrication and Installation of first NPS waysides and signs   This multi-phase project involves the design, fabrication and installation of a variety of National Park Service signage, including; park entrance signs, orientation kiosks, wayside exhibits and auto-tour directional signage. Completion Date: Late 2016  Programs     History at Sunset Program Series –A series of nine (9) special interpretive programs which cover a wide variety of subjects on the history of the Shenandoah Valley, from pre-settlement through the Civil War.Offered at sites both within the park and throughout the National Historic District, most programs provide visitors an opportunity to see sites not normally open, or widely accessible, to the general public, allowing them to explore and learn about some of the "hidden gems" of the park and NHD.   Dates: June –October 2016     Battlefield Series programs - A series of nine (9) special two-hour programs which highlight numerous sites and resources associated with the Battle of Cedar Creek (October 19, 1864) and the Civil War in the Shenandoah Valley.   Dates:Offered on select Saturdays May –October, 2016     National Park Service Star Parties –A series of special star gazing parties, held in conjunction with the Shenandoah Astronomical Society and the Shenandoah Valley Battlefields Foundation.Each program includes an introductory ranger program, followed by astronomical lessons and observations from members of the SAS.Visitors are encouraged to bring their own telescopes or use those provided by the SAS.   Dates: April 2, August 13 and October 1 (call about inclement weather changes)     Creation of NPS Education programs –creation of two curriculum based programs (one for off-site/school presentations and one for park-based programs) which would mark the official start of NPS education programs at the park.These programs, based on the park's primary interpretive themes, would be targeted for 4th grade classes, but could also be offered to a wide variety of grades and/or youth groups (home school, scout, etc.).All programs would be created to meet Virginia SOLs.   Date:Fall/winter 2016     Events    Winchester-Frederick County/Clark County Civil War Weekend –A series of special programs, activities and events to highlight and interpret the rich Civil War history of Frederick and Clark counties.Held in conjunction with the Winchester-Frederick County VCB, Shenandoah Valley Battlefields Foundation and various partner sites throughout the two counties.Tentative NPS plans include special ranger programs on the new Morning Attack Trails area, along with living history demonstrations and encampments on the same site.   Date: August 19-21, 2016     Battle of Third Winchester Commemoration –A series of special events and programs, held in partnership with the Shenandoah Valley Battlefields Foundation to commemorate and interpret the 152nd anniversary of the Battle of Third Winchester (September 19, 1864).   Dates: September 23-25, 2016     Battle of Cedar Creek Commemoration –A series of special events and programs, held in partnership with the Cedar Creek Battlefield Foundation, Belle Grove and Shenandoah Valley Battlefields Foundation to commemorate and interpret the 152nd anniversary of the Battle of Cedar Creek (October 19, 1864).   Dates: October 14-16, 2016
